param.name: seedlength
param.label: Seed length used by the read aligner
param.help: Providing the correct value for this parameter is important for RSEM's accuracy if the data are single-end reads. RSEM uses this value for Bowtie's seed length parameter. The minimum value is 25. (Default:25)

param.name: forward_prob
param.label: Is the library strand specific?
param.option: Yes, the reads (or first reads from paired-end libraries) are only in the forward orientation
Yes, the reads (or first reads from paired-end libraries) are only in the reverse orientation

param.name: fragment_length_min
param.label: Minimum read/insert length.
param.help: This is also the value for the bowtie -I option

param.name: fragment_length_max
param.label: Maximum read/insert length.
param.help: This is also the value for the bowtie -X option

param.name: fragment_length_mean
param.label: Fragment length mean (single-end data only)
param.help: The mean of the fragment length distribution, which is assumed to be a Gaussian. (Default: -1, which disables use of the fragment length distribution)

param.name: fragment_length_sd
param.label: The standard deviation of the fragment length distribution (single-end data only)
param.help: Default 0, which assumes that all fragments are of the same length, given by the rounded value of fragment length mean.

param.name: estimate
param.label: Read Start Position Distribution (RSPD)
param.help: Set this option if you want to estimate the read start position distribution (RSPD) from data. Otherwise, RSEM will use a uniform RSPD.
param.option: Estimate and correct for a non-uniform RSPD

param.name: num_rspd_bins
param.label: Number of bins in the RSPD.
param.help: Use of the default setting of 20 is recommended.

param.name: cimem
param.label: Amount of memory in (MB) for computing CI

param.name: bowtie_n
param.label: Bowtie mismatches
param.help: Bowtie parameter max # of mismatches in the seed. (Range: 0-3, Default: 2)

validator.message: max # of mismatches in the seed between 0 and 3

param.name: bowtie_e
param.label: Maximum sum of quality scores at mismatched positions in read alignments. This is also the value for the Bowtie -e option

param.name: bowtie_m
param.label: Discard alignments for reads with number of alignments greater than

param.name: bowtie2_k
param.label: --bowtie2-k
param.help: Find up to `int` alignments per read. (Default: 200)

param.name: bowtie2_sensitivity_level
param.label: --bowtie2-sensitivity-level
param.help: Set Bowtie 2's preset options in --end-to-end mode. This option controls how hard Bowtie 2 tries to find alignments. Must be one of "very_fast", "fast", "sensitive" and "very_sensitive". The four candidates correspond to Bowtie 2's "--very-fast", "--fast", "--sensitive" and "--very-sensitive" options. (Default: "sensitive" - use Bowtie 2's default)

param.name: sampling_for_bam
param.label: Use sampling for BAM
param.help: When RSEM generates a BAM file, instead of outputing all alignments a read has with their posterior probabilities, one alignment is sampled according to the posterior probabilities. The sampling procedure includes the alignment to the "noise" transcript, which does not appear in the BAM file. Only the sampled alignment has a weight of 1. All other alignments have weight 0. If the "noise" transcript is sampled, all alignments appeared in the BAM file should have weight 0. (Default: off)
